pullRequest.title: [Offline sync] Allow user to specify connection type for sync
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #408
@dturner PTAL
Tested manually:

Turn the setting to sync Over Wi-Fi only on
Toggle Wifi off and keep Mobile Data on
Add a new observation and also attach a photo
Click "save"
Observe that the form data is saved but the photo isn't uploaded
Turn on wifi
Photo gets synced in the background automatically

commit.message: Add shared pref filename and mode to Config.java

Use the same config in SettingsFragment

 - This makes all shared prefs stored via SettingsFragment accessible through LocalValueStore across the application.
Add getter for the network constraint in LocalValueStore
Create BaseWorkManager and add template for requests/constraints

Refactor child WorkManager classes

 - Simplify by removing duplicate code
 - If no custom config is needed, then use base template. Otherwise, override appropriate methods

nodes.bodyText:
We might want to change this to shouldUploadMediaOverUnmeteredConnectionOnly. Whilst most Wi-Fi connections are unmetered some are not (hotspot tethering, airport Wi-Fi), also with 5G there are some mobile connections which are unmetered.
My point being: we're presumably trying to avoid the user being charged for data rather than simply letting them choose a specific network protocol.
Out of interest, what caused this to become public?
Any reason for picking LINEAR backoff? I thought the generally accepted best practice was to use EXPONENTIAL
Please add class JavaDoc with quick summary of what this base class provides.
Consider adding a noargs override of buildWorkerRquest() instead of passing null here with JavaDoc explaining the default behavior with noargs.

commit.message: Add javadoc comments and switch backoff policy to exponential
Create no-arg override of buildWorkerRequest()  and comments
Revert back to LINEAR policy and add a TODO
